intro: Serratula chartacea, commonly known as the common serrated centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are serrated and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture. Serratula chartacea is often found in grasslands, rocky soils, and along roadsides, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
